description.narrative: Extension of Alliance Against Hunger <(>&<)> malnutrition (AAHM - II) The Alliance against Hunger and Malnutrition (AAHM) is a global network comprising of civil society, intergovernmental organizations and international NGOs. AAHM in Pakistan was establishedto provide both international and national expertise with a platform to fight hunger and malnutrition.SCOPE started establishing the national chapter of international AAHM in collaboration with OXFAM Novib under the Grow Campaign in December 2012. It is an informal forum of different stakeholders comprising civil society organizations (CSOs) including NGOs, media, farmers# organizations, women#s groups, trade unions etc., Inter-governmental organizations, international NGOs (INGOs), UN agencies and donors, Experts and academiain individual capacity as advisors. Through the categorized membership campaign stakeholders identified and data base was developed. Website of AAHM Pakistan and IEC material established on the issue of food security, Malnutrition,land rights and land reforms. A strong networking established which will be utilized in future at common platforms of AAHM and Grow Campaign- to eradicate food insecurity, hunger and malnutrition in Pakistan. In collaboration with Ministry of National FoodSecurity and Research National launchingof AAHM was held in June, 2013 in Islamabad, and has established liaison with Planning and Development Commission and Ministry of Health as well. Under AAHM Oxfam <(>&<)> Scope have established a think tank for feedbackmechanism on food prices and food security policy, and have undertaken a scoping study on food security situation in the country last year. Regular Information sharing among all relevant stakeholders through circular emails on vital issues related to food and nutrition security in Pakistan

1. Legal status - Registration for income tax exemption and authorization to receive foreign funds (if applicable)
SCOPE is registered under Societies Act of Pakistan 1860, with registration No. KAR 1735, 1990 under Registrar Joint Stock Companies, Ministry of Industries, Government of Sindh. The society has a tax exemption status
2. With regard to governance and control systems - Code of Conduct (on integrity and ethical values)
SCOPE is a non profit, non political organization which works for all citizens without consideration of caste, colour, ethnicity, religion and gender. SCOPE gives priority to work for the poorest of the poor. SCOPE believes in democracy, openness and transparency. SCOPE avoids any exploitative policy of funding which may result in economical exploitation of poor people. SCOPE scans its projects carefully and make sure to avoid child labour, gender discrimination, sexual harassmentat work place, and any harm whatsoever to the beneficiaries.
- Description of Board System ( Who appoints, TOR Board, Composition, Rotation, Finance/Audit Committee)
- SCOPE is a membership based organization. General members form general assembly or General Body, which elects a Managing Committee (or the board) every five years. The Managing Committee comprises over following 8 members oroffice bearers; - President, vice president, general secretary, joint secretary, finance secretary, chief executive officer, 2 members. - The managing committee or board is a governing body which ensures that policy made by general body are to be adopted, followed and executed by the executive staff. The Managing Body meets at least four times annually to review programme and progress of SCOPE and provide policy guidelines and functions as a regulatory authority.
- Description of governance of the organisation
The General Body is supreme decision making organ of the society, which makes policies, approve budget, and appoint auditors. The Managing Committee is responsible to implement policies formed by General Body. The chief executive officer (CEO) is overall in charge of the organization responsible for implementation of overall programme. CEO is assisted by programme manager and manager administration andfinance. The three officers, i.e. CEO, PM and Manager Administration and Finance form a #Management and Monitoring Committee#, which meets every week to take day to day management related decisions and regulate program and finance related matters. On behalf of this committee, CEO is responsible to report to Managing Committee (Board).
